page.title: 17Housing around Water
page.content: Internally many terraced houses have been rebuilt to match the developments since their building,e.g.connection to main services,the last one being electricity, and inside toilets and modern kitchens. Central heating has replaced the open fires and the houses are now bright and clean. In the 1930s and 1950s semi -detached brick built or cement rendered houses were constructed, sometimes in large estates for the town council, sometimes in small groups by local builders. Since 1965 the pattern has been estates of 20 or 30 similar,not identical houses in brick with tiled roofs. Attached garages reflect the use of the motor car. Garden provision has become almost universal as well. The latest change is the use of plastic window and door frames.
